main event: On November 13, 1957, observers spotted a round object changing colors in the sky over Hopkins and St. Paul, Minnesota.
interesting points: The object changed size from that of a silver dollar to a basketball., Observers noted the object's movement was erratic, moving and stopping repeatedly., There was significant public interest due to Venus being bright and close to Earth at the time., Local police received calls about the sighting broadcasted over the police network., The report concluded that the sighting may have been caused by a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
witness description: civilians from the Hopkins and St. Paul areas
